result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon C. Coyne

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon C. Coyne not in court. Court orders judgment on bail forfeiture. Minutes filed.

Defendant Brandon C. Coyne not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Brandon C. Coyne. Called @ 3:53 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status. Atty. does not know why defendant is not present. State asks for warrant and bail forfeiture. Court issues warrant and forfeits bond. Court in recess.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Not guilty pleas entered by Atty. Uzowulu on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:05 p.m. No appearances by the defense. Court goes off the record and asks Atty. Selmek to find out who took over case for Atty. Kim. Matter recalled @ 308 p.m. Attorney Uzowulu appears for the defendant who does not appear. Record by Atty. as to non-appearance of defendant. State requests warrant and bail forfeiture. Response by Atty. Uzowulu who asks the court to allow him to phone the defendant before warrant is issued. Court grants the request and goes off the record.
Recalled @ 3:14 p.m. - Statement by Atty. Uzowulu that defendant is entering the building, and will be waiving today. Court goes back off the record to allow paperwork to be completed.
Recalled @ 3:23 p.m. - Waiver provided to the Court. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant who responds to Court's questions. Atty. Uzowulu responds to further questions of the Court as to waiver. Court finds waiver to be knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause, and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Record by Atty. Uzowulu who is ready to proceed to arraignment, and enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant, waives speedy and requests a status hearing in about 90 days. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:00 PM - Defendant Brandon C. Coyne not in court.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Brandon C. Coyne. Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case was scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing.
Attorney Kim made a record, unsure where his client is. May be incarcerated.
Attorney Kim will investigate and is requesting this hearing be re-scheduled.
State objects and is requesting a warrant be issued for Mr. Coyne arrest and bond forfeited.
Court will authorize a warrant, and forfeit bond STAYED until next court date of 04/22/2022 at 3PM before Commissioner Navis.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brandon C. Coyne appeared in court, Attorney Tony Kim for Brandon C. Coyne appeared in court. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon C. Coyne appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 2:33 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Defendant responds to Court's questions regarding status of attorney. Defendant thought he would have pubic defender here today. Court addresses Atty. Renner who is in the Courtroom regarding status of public defender. Atty. Renner checks with the office and defendant needs to call them and reapply. Court instructs defendant to take care of that today and resets the matter. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Brandon C. Coyne appeared, J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 2/11/2022 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.M.C.  OR RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-625 thru 22-627
